item.title: 无人机袭击导致莫斯科发电厂起火
item.description: 在特朗普政府推动的和平计划下，俄罗斯和乌克兰加强了对能源基础设施的攻击。【原文：An overnight drone strike triggered a fire at the Shatura power plant supplying Moscow, as Russia and Ukraine step up attacks on energy infrastructure amid a peace plan pushed by the Trump administration.】

item.title: 马斯克称特斯拉即将推出 AI5 芯片，并开始 AI6 的研发工作
item.description: 特斯拉首席执行官埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）周日在一篇 X 帖子中表示，特斯拉已接近其 AI5 芯片设计流程的最后一步，并开始着手开发新的 AI6 芯片，该芯片将部署在特斯拉的汽车和数据中心中。【原文：Tesla is nearing the final step of the design process for its AI5 chip and starting work on a new AI6 chip to be deployed in its cars and data centers, Tesla CEO Elon Musk said Sunday in an X post.】

item.title: DHL 斥资 1.5 亿美元在利雅得设立枢纽，押注沙特业务扩张
item.description: DHL 供应链计划投资 1.3 亿欧元（1.5 亿美元）建设利雅得物流枢纽，将沙特阿拉伯打造为地区贸易门户作为赌注。【原文：DHL Supply Chain plans to invest €130 million ($150 million) in a Riyadh logistics hub, betting on Saudi Arabia’s push to become a regional trade gateway.】

item.title: 据说 MBK 将收到与 Homeplus 有关的严厉制裁通知
item.description: 据说韩国金融监管部门已向 MBK Partners Ltd. 发出通知，要求对该收购公司持有的零售商 Homeplus Co.【原文：South Korea’s financial watchdog is said to have sent MBK Partners Ltd. a notice on possible penalties related to retailer Homeplus Co., one of the buyout firm’s holdings.】

item.title: 凯雷集团为印度基金募集 3 亿美元资金
item.description: 凯雷投资集团公司（Carlyle Group Inc.【原文：Carlyle Group Inc. is launching an India side fund to operate along the firm’s sixth pan-Asia investment vehicle, to tap opportunities in everything from tech to health care.】

item.title: 专家小组成员称高市将积极干预日元走势
item.description: 一位政府小组成员表示，日本对干预货币市场持开放态度，"以减轻日元疲软的副作用"，这反映了首相佐那江隆一对通货膨胀的担忧。【原文：Japan is open to intervening in the currency market “to mitigate the side effects of a weak yen,” a government panel member said, reflecting Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi’s concerns about inflation.】

item.title: 新加坡对涉嫌王子诈骗集团的调查随着突袭行动而扩大
item.description: 新加坡当局突袭了一家向与太子控股集团有关的公司借款的汽车贷款公司，对与被指控的诈骗组织及其主席陈智有关的人进行了进一步的调查。【原文：Singapore authorities raided a car loan company that borrowed from a firm connected to Prince Holding Group, as the net widens on those linked to the alleged scam organization and its chair Chen Zhi.】

item.title: 里夫斯将冻结铁路票价，作为英国生活费用调控举措的一部分
item.description: 英国政府表示将在即将到来的预算中冻结铁路票价，财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）试图帮助选民降低生活成本，抑制通货膨胀。【原文：The UK government said it would freeze rail fares in the upcoming budget, as Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves seeks to help voters with the cost-of-living and curb inflation.】

item.title: 全球股市大涨令韩国市场头痛不已
item.description: 本月，"Kospi 4,000 "的字样在韩国交易所的巨型屏幕上闪烁着耀眼的黄色光芒，这是一年前很少有人能想象到的惊人涨势的纪念碑。对一些投资者来说，这也是一个警示信号。【原文：The words ‘Kospi 4,000’ have been glowing in gaudy yellow text across a giant screen wrapping the Korea Exchange this month, a monument to the spectacular rally that few imagined possible just a year ago. For some investors, it’s also a warning sign.】

item.title: 新西兰总理卢克松承诺增加养老金储蓄计划
item.description: 新西兰总理克里斯托弗-卢克松（Christopher Luxon）表示，他将提高工人的养老金支付额度，使新西兰与邻国澳大利亚的养老金支付额度更加一致。【原文：New Zealand Prime Minister Christopher Luxon said he will raise the amount that workers pay into pensions, bringing the country more in line with neighboring Australia.】

item.title: 英国计划在国内生产其关键矿物需求的 10
item.description: 英国首相基尔-斯塔默（Keir Starmer）公布了一项战略，在国内生产关键矿物，减少对脆弱的全球供应链的依赖。【原文：British Prime Minister Keir Starmer unveiled a strategy to make critical minerals at home and reduce reliance on the fragile global supply chain.】

item.title: 英国将延长电动汽车补贴以抵消预算案中的增税措施
item.description: 英国政府将增加对电动汽车的补贴，以缓解下周预算案中针对电动汽车的增税措施。【原文：The UK government will increase subsidies for electric vehicles as it seeks to mitigate a tax rise that’s expected to target the cars at next week’s budget.】

item.title: 美国零售销售表现坚挺，但风险也随之增加
item.description: 9 月份，美国零售销售增长可能略有放缓，为消费者本季度的稳健消费画上了句号，但他们仍对高物价感到沮丧，对就业保障感到焦虑。【原文：US retail sales growth likely moderated a touch in September, capping an otherwise solid quarter of spending by consumers who are nonetheless frustrated by high prices and anxious about job security.】

item.title: 私募股权公司涌入垃圾债市场为自己买单
item.description: 私募股权公司在为其投资项目寻找买家的过程中举步维艰，它们正前所未有地求助于一种古老的玩法。【原文：Private equity firms, struggling to find buyers for their investments, are turning to an old playbook like never before.】

item.title: 瑞士央行施莱格尔称瑞士通胀率将在未来数月回升
item.description: 瑞士国家银行行长马丁-施莱格尔（Martin Schlegel）表示，瑞士的消费价格增长有望略有加快。【原文：Consumer-price growth in Switzerland is expected to accelerate a bit, according to Swiss National Bank President Martin Schlegel.】

item.title: 哈佛大学遭黑客攻击，常春藤联盟网络攻击最新案例
item.description: 哈佛大学校友、捐赠者、部分学生和教师的数据库在受到电话钓鱼攻击后被 "未经授权的一方 "访问，这是常春藤盟校受到的最新网络攻击，也是哈佛大学今年第二次调查漏洞事件。【原文：A Harvard University database of alumni, donors, some students and faculty was accessed by “an unauthorized party” after a phone phishing attack, the latest cyberattack on Ivy League schools and the second time Harvard has investigated a breach this year.】

item.title: 美联储观察家转向计票，12 月利率大戏愈演愈烈
item.description: 最近几周，美联储内部的分歧愈演愈烈，官员们在央行12月的政策会议前各持己见，而主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔则保持沉默。【原文：Division at the Federal Reserve has intensified in recent weeks, with officials staking out disparate positions ahead of the central bank’s December policy meeting — all while Chair Jerome Powell stays silent.】

item.title: 房利美和房地美股价模仿 "备忘录股票 "狂热波动
item.description: 比尔-阿克曼（Bill Ackman）点燃了这把火，而比尔-普尔特（Bill Pulte）则为这把火增添了动力。【原文：Bill Ackman lit the fire and Bill Pulte supercharged it.】

item.title: 零售股需要不太可能出现的假日奇迹来挽救 2025 年的颓势
item.description: 美国消费者正步入假期旺季。【原文：The American consumer is limping into the holiday season.】

item.title: 美联储主席柯林斯称尚未决定是否在 12 月进行加息投票
item.description: 波士顿联邦储备银行行长苏珊-柯林斯（Susan Collins）在表示可能赞成维持利率不变一天后，又说她还没有决定在美联储下次政策会议上如何投票。【原文：A day after signaling she may favor keeping rates on hold, Federal Reserve Bank of Boston President Susan Collins said she hadn’t made up her mind over how to vote at the Fed’s next policy meeting.】

item.title: 泰国央行认为有降息空间，希望泰铢走软
item.description: 泰国新任央行行长表示，泰铢应该走弱以反映经济基本面，而且还有进一步放宽货币政策的空间。【原文：Thailand’s newly-appointed central bank governor says the baht should be weaker to reflect economic fundamentals, and there is room to ease monetary policy further.】

item.title: 阿联酋计划向非洲人工智能基础设施投资 10 亿美元
item.description: 阿拉伯联合酋长国计划投资 10 亿美元，在非洲各地扩展人工智能基础设施和服务，加强其对非洲大陆的影响力，因为非洲大陆在采用人工智能技术方面落后于世界其他地区。【原文：The United Arab Emirates plans to invest $1 billion to expand artificial intelligence infrastructure and services across Africa, bolstering its influence on a continent that’s lagged behind the rest of the world in adopting the technology.】

item.title: 加密货币本月的暴跌引发华尔街压力测试
item.description: 对于比特币死忠来说，命运逆转已经不是什么新鲜事了。每隔几年就会发生一次，或者每当情绪崩溃时也会发生。【原文：Reversals of fortune are nothing new for Bitcoin diehards — euphoric rallies, then brutal selloffs. They happen every few years, or whenever sentiment snaps.】

item.title: Wi-Fi 巨头越南工厂引发中国分裂问题
item.description: 在中国成立的 Wi-Fi 巨头 TP-Link 系统公司正试图说服美国国家安全官员相信它独立于中国政府。该公司在越南的工厂生产运往美国的产品，围绕该工厂的情况表明，要做到这一点可能有多难。【原文：China-founded Wi-Fi behemoth TP-Link Systems Inc. is trying to convince US national security officials it’s independent from Beijing. The circumstances surrounding its Vietnam factory, where the company makes products to ship to the US, show how hard that may be.】

item.title: 南希-佩洛西 2022 年的台湾之行如何帮助日本决定重新开火
item.description: 历史一次又一次地证明了意外后果的力量。【原文：Time and again, history shows the power of unintended consequences.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长拉加德称货币政策无法解决债务问题
item.description: 欧洲中央银行行长克里斯蒂娜-拉加德（Christine Lagarde）警告说，不要将货币政策视为解决债务问题的办法，并含蓄地拒绝了法国极右翼政党最近提出的该机构应重新启动大规模资产购买的建议。【原文：European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde warned against seeing monetary policy as a solution to debt problems, implicitly rejecting recent suggestions from France’s far-right party that the institution should relaunch large-scale asset purchases.】

item.title: 全球经济图表：美国就业增长超出预期
item.description: 美国 9 月份的就业增长超过了预期，而失业率却有所上升，这说明劳动力市场的脆弱令美国消费者感到不安。【原文：US employment growth exceeded forecasts while the jobless rate ticked higher in September, illustrating a tenuous labor market that is unnerving American consumers.】

item.title: 白俄罗斯领导人根据与特朗普达成的协议赦免 31 名乌克兰人
item.description: 作为与美国总统唐纳德-特朗普达成的协议的一部分，白俄罗斯总统亚历山大-卢卡申科赦免了 31 名在前苏联共和国被判有罪的乌克兰人。【原文：Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko pardoned 31 Ukrainians convicted of crimes in the former Soviet republic as part of agreements reached with US President Donald Trump.】

item.title: 贝利的历史教训表明里夫斯无力推动增长
item.description: 与许多英国首相一样，雷切尔-里夫斯进入唐宁街时也承诺要重振经济，但迄今为止，她未能带来多大改变。【原文：Like many British chancellors, Rachel Reeves entered Downing Street on a promise to fire up the economy but has failed, so far, to make much difference.】

item.title: 为什么美国的牧场主不断受到挤压？
item.description:
牛肉现在如此昂贵的真正原因。【原文：

The real reason beef is so expensive right now.

】
